intro: Xanthostemon graniticus, commonly known as the granite grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Xanthostemon graniticus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland regions with low rainfall.
